meanings.definition: To cause someone to adopt radical positions or beliefs.
meanings.sent1: The group tried to radicalise young people by promoting extreme ideas.
meanings.sent2: Some individuals may radicalise after being exposed to certain ideologies.
meanings.sent3: The idea of a pizza-only diet could radicalise even the most dedicated salad lovers.
meanings.sent4: Her passion for art radicalised her approach to creativity, leading to groundbreaking works.
meanings.sent5: The intense storm seemed to radicalise the normally calm sea, causing massive waves.

meanings.definition: To become radical in one's beliefs or actions.
meanings.sent1: He started to radicalise after attending a series of political rallies.
meanings.sent2: Over time, some individuals may radicalise due to personal experiences.
meanings.sent3: The idea of wearing mismatched socks could radicalise his fashion sense.
meanings.sent4: Her determination to succeed radicalised her approach to challenges, making her unstoppable.
meanings.sent5: The vibrant colors of the sunset seemed to radicalise the sky, painting it in hues of orange and pink.
